issue.title: Tuya devices contantly become unavailable
issue.body:
## The problem
<!-- 
  Describe the issue you are experiencing here to communicate to the
  maintainers. Tell us what you were trying to do and what happened.
-->
I have multiple tuya smart lights at home. All of them periodically become unavailable in HA. Basically every day with rare exception I need to disconenct them from power, connect to the socket again, then use Start Life app to turn on and off agai and only then they become available in HA again for another few days. I am not sure wether it is an issue with all tuya devices or just lights because I only one other tuya device, a T&H sensor, that is super cheap and works very poorly anyways. However, logs show that the connection is being dropped with it as well.

## Environment
<!--
  Provide details about your environment.
-->
- Localtuya version: 5.2.1
- Home Assistant Core version: 2023.10.3
- [] Does the device work using the Home Assistant Tuya Cloud component ? <!-- if yes, put a x between the two [] => [x] -->
- [] Does the device work using the Tinytuya (https://github.com/jasonacox/tinytuya) command line tool ? <!-- if yes, put a x between the two [] => [x] -->
- [] Was the device working with earlier versions of localtuya ? Which one? <!-- if yes, put a x between the two [] => [x] -->
- [] Are you using the Tuya/SmartLife App in parallel ? <!-- if yes, put a x between the two [] => [x] -->

SmartLife is used only to reconnect a unavailable device. Also access from all tuya devices is blocked on my router and pihole.

## Steps to reproduce
<!--
  Clearly define how to reproduce the issue. 
-->
1. Connect smart lights;
2. Sett them up;
3. Check if the whole functionality works;
4. Wait a few days; 
5. It is broken again.


## DP dump
<!-- 
  Paste here a DP dump, see https://github.com/rospogrigio/localtuya/wiki/HOWTO-get-a-DPs-dump
  You can also try to qualify your device using the procedure described https://github.com/rospogrigio/localtuya/wiki/Qualifying-a-device
-->

    DPS [22] VALUE [658] 
    DPS [23] VALUE [800]

root@Wizard:~/tuyadebug#

  Provide logs if they are relevant. In detail, it is useful to be able to compare working with non-working situations, such as HA logs compared to the output of the tuyadebug script or the tinytuya CLI tool. 
  To increase the debugging level of HA for the devices, check the "enable debug" button when configuring the device, and set the log level to debug for this component at least:
  In configuration.yaml:

  logger.set_level
  custom_components.localtuya: debug
  custom_components.localtuya.pytuya: debug
-->

comment.body:
> Same issue on my setup as well. After day or two all devices get disconnected. HA restart fixes the issue. 

In my case restarting HA does not fix the issue. The only solution I've found so far is disconnecting the lights from power thus forcing a reboot, then executing one command in SmartLife. Only then they become available again.

issue.title: Error adding access keypad
issue.body:
<!-- READ THIS FIRST:
  - For a new device, first check if you can find a similar device in the https://github.com/rospogrigio/localtuya/wiki/Known-working-and-non-working-devices
  - Try to update to latest master version, your problem may be already fixed.
  - Do not report issues for already existing problems. Check that an issue is not already opened and enrich it.
  - Provide as many details as possible. Paste logs, configuration samples and code into the backticks.
-->
## The problem
I have a Tuya Access Keypad and I cannot add it to localtuya.
The device can be seen [here](https://www.aliexpress.com/item/4000334211110.html). 

## Environment
<!--
  Provide details about your environment.
-->
- Localtuya version: <!-- plugin version from HACS, master, commit id --> v5.2.1 from HACS
- Home Assistant Core version: Home Assistant 2023.10.3 Supervisor 2023.10.0 Operating System 11.0 Frontend 20231005.0 - latest
- [x] Does the device work using the Home Assistant Tuya Cloud component ? <!-- if yes, put a x between the two [] => [x] --> yes
- [] Does the device work using the Tinytuya (https://github.com/jasonacox/tinytuya) command line tool ? <!-- if yes, put a x between the two [] => [x] --> not tested
- [] Was the device working with earlier versions of localtuya ? Which one? <!-- if yes, put a x between the two [] => [x] --> not tested
- [x] Are you using the Tuya/SmartLife App in parallel ? <!-- if yes, put a x between the two [] => [x] --> yes

## Steps to reproduce
<!--
  Clearly define how to reproduce the issue. 
-->
1. go to devices -> local tuya integration -> configure
2. add new device and select device from the list
3. fill in details and local key, hit submit
4. Error occurs: "Connection to device succeeded but no datapoints found, please try again. Create a new issue and include debug logs if problem persists."
This error occurs with protocols 3.1, 3.2, 3.3. With protocol 3.4 it just times out after a few minutes.

## DP dump
<!-- 
  Paste here a DP dump, see https://github.com/rospogrigio/localtuya/wiki/HOWTO-get-a-DPs-dump
  You can also try to qualify your device using the procedure described https://github.com/rospogrigio/localtuya/wiki/Qualifying-a-device
-->
Unable to run DP dump. The local key of the device ends with a ")" and the script fails.
I have examined the device status and found out what changes when it sends unlock signal. See below.

      {
        "code": "closed_opened_kit",
        "custom_name": "",
        "dp_id": 35,
        "time": 1694074129492,
        "value": "AQAC"  _**---------> this becomes AQAB when the door unlocks**_
      },

## Provide Home Assistant traceback/logs
<!--

  In configuration.yaml:

  logger.set_level
  custom_components.localtuya: debug
  custom_components.localtuya.pytuya: debug
-->

issue.title: Cannot access to devices in another LAN area
issue.body:
Used LocalTuya to retrieve energy monitoring from a Tuya device (Tuya Cloud do not report them).

I need access to a device in my Garage and it is connected via 4G router and I assumed LocalTuya could connect them with manual configuration.

- Used the public IP address of the device retrieved from Tuya Cloud but it does not work (maybe they have CGNAT also?)
- Mapped the local IP with port 6686 to the 4G router and used the public IP address of the Router but it fails (possibly due to CGNAT)
- Tried creating an IPSEC tunnel to the 4G router but IPSEC fails against CGNAT
- Used DynDNS to advertise the actual IP addresses but it does not work

Question is: if it works with Tuya Cloud, the device is reachable. Why not working with Local Tuya? Am I missing any

issue.title: Tuya devices contantly become unavailable
issue.body:
## The problem
<!-- 
  Describe the issue you are experiencing here to communicate to the
  maintainers. Tell us what you were trying to do and what happened.
-->
I have multiple tuya smart lights at home. All of them periodically become unavailable in HA. Basically every day with rare exception I need to disconenct them from power, connect to the socket again, then use Start Life app to turn on and off agai and only then they become available in HA again for another few days. I am not sure wether it is an issue with all tuya devices or just lights because I only one other tuya device, a T&H sensor, that is super cheap and works very poorly anyways. However, logs show that the connection is being dropped with it as well.

## Environment
<!--
  Provide details about your environment.
-->
- Localtuya version: 5.2.1
- Home Assistant Core version: 2023.10.3
- [] Does the device work using the Home Assistant Tuya Cloud component ? <!-- if yes, put a x between the two [] => [x] -->

- [] Are you using the Tuya/SmartLife App in parallel ? <!-- if yes, put a x between the two [] => [x] -->

SmartLife is used only to reconnect a unavailable device. Also access from all tuya devices is blocked on my router and pihole.

<!--
  Clearly define how to reproduce the issue. 
-->
1. Connect smart lights;
2. Sett them up;
3. Check if the whole functionality works;
4. Wait a few days; 
5. It is broken again.
